newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petrofields to give Benguet buy-in option.
newsitem.headline: Petrofields to give Benguet buy-in option.

text.p: Petrofields Exploration and Development Co Inc said on Wednesday it planned to grant Benguet Corp the option to buy 16 billion Petrofields shares at the par value of one centavo each.

The option will be part of a project agreement to be signed by both mining companies if Petrofields decides to develop a 240 hectare property owned by Benguet, Petrofields president Milagros Reyes told the Philippine Stock Exchange.
The buy-in could be exercisable in tranches over a period of three years, Reyes added. The 16 billion shares represent about 10 percent of Petrofields.

Petrofields and Benguet signed on Tuesday a memorandum of understanding to study the possibility of developing a Benguet property just outside the mountain resort of Baguio city into a mixed-use residential, commercial and recreational estate.
Under the agreement, Petrofields will have a maximum of 90 days to conduct due diligence.
If Petrofields decides to pursue the project, it would invest 500 million pesos in planning, development and construction of the project.
In return, it would get 70 percent share of the first 400 milion pesos worth of revenues, and 50 percent of the profits after that.
